text:
UPDATE (30/04-17:00): Cardiff University has released a statement saying one student was effected. This is a lie.
---------
Multiple Cardiff University students have returned to collect belongings from their University-run Halls of Residence only to find their belongings binned, trashed and ruined with complete disregard for sentimental value. Some belongings being outright stolen.
On top of the irreversible damage and loss Students' belongings, masses of non-perishable food has simply been chucked away rather than going to those who could really need it in a time like now.
The University promised that these belongings would be kept safe, but clearly, have FAILED 😡

text:
#CardiffConfession7196
The Memory of You
Throughout the summer I felt your scent
In the street, at home, and anywhere I went
I felt your touch in the back of my mind
In a memory better left behind
You were perfect in theory but I can’t forget
The way you hurt me last year when we met
For the first time in a while, I let my guard down
I blindly trusted you would stick around
But you went and ruined something so sweet
A memory now tarnished with the tears I weep
And now I’m at a moral conundrum, left to decide
If I should forgive you or find a place to hide
I wanted to avoid you because I knew all this time
That if I saw you I’d still want you to me mine
But my self worth has increased since last year
So now I choose myself over having you near
- KayDee
Ps. I wrote this in the beginning of the year. I’m only submitting this because I’m drunk lol
It probably isn’t even good, but if someone relates that enough. Also my name isn’t KayDee, but I like it xx

text:
#CardiffConfession7188
Has anyone else felt extremely down these last few weeks? I’ve completely lost my sense of self, I feel useless, the company of everyone in my household isn’t cutting it. I feel extremely lonely. I’m extremely exhausted and can’t find a single thing to motivate me, I can’t even stick to my uni work let alone watch TV. I’ve had what I’d describe as depressive episodes almost everyday, but I can’t control how I feel, even though I may have a good day I’ll have a sudden outburst of tears and unease. The uncertainty of when all of this will end is slowly breaking me. The support I get from my household is pretty useless, the advice I get is usually “at least you aren’t dead”, which I’m so grateful that I’m healthy, but I’m not happy and I don’t know how I can go on like this for much longer. I’ve tried so many services online, but none are helpful. Most have told me to imagine a fluffy blanket that’s my favourite colour...nothing seems to help

Confession. I'm gonna miss Cardiff Uni. I'm gonna miss all the people who have helped me have a good time. I'm gonna miss all the people who gave me a bad time. Thank you.

Is it normal to have a complete lack of motivation? There's nothing I want to do, there's nothing I feel like doing and I could literally spend my whole day just watching YouTube. I can't start my course work even though I have nothing else to do. I put off everything until last minute because I can't delay anymore. People around me have aspirations for the future but I don't have any wants for mine. "Do you want to go on a trip?" I could care less, whether I go or not, it wouldn't really matter to me. There's nothing in life that I'm looking forward to. I'm definitely not suicidal because I don't want life itself to end. Is this depression or does everyone feel like this? Am I just overthinking?

text:
#CardiffConfession7171
(please post as there has been much debate and snakery going on in our household)
What is everyone's opinions on splitting bills during this lockdown time. Understandably, 3 out of our 6 person household have returned home to self isolate with their families, leaving 3 of us still in our house in Cathays. Of course we've all signed a contract to split everything evenly, however those who are not here think that they should pay lower bills.
Is this fair?
Some of us do not have the same opportunity as others to go home home, and even if the house was empty there would still be bills that need to be paid as the house is still generating electricity/ connected to sewers, etc. Also the people who have left have the option to stay in cathays but have chosen to leave?
What are other households doing? Splitting bills same or altering proportions of payments?

text:
#CardiffConfession7123
I'm just a regular guy in a house full of girls and none of them care about their hair clogging up the shower which is fine by me tbh. There's a rare pleasure in the earnest anticipation of what your next pull will be. Is it going to be a sensual flow of hairs gently untangling through each hole of the drain or perhaps a thunderous sadomasochistic battle between the snapping fibres of my body and those of the slimy strands of a well-aged mermaid wig. Either is an experience of its own and I've learnt to cultivate the sensation of each one with utmost care, respect, and pleasure. If my housemates see this, I hope one day you too get to experience the absolute bliss which is the shower drain after a good 3 months of neglect. After time, you'll find that like good wine, accumulating hair in the drain takes patience and the reward can hardly be summarised in a single Cardiff confessions post

Right the only thing we all care about
Ranking of garlic breads
God tier - 35p garlic bread from tesco on Salisbury road (RIP gone but never forgotten)
Good tier - co-op £1.70 for 2, I know it’s co-op but give it a chance. Perfect amount of garlic butter, only reason it’s not god tier is because who really wants to spend 85p per garlic bread
Average tier - tesco 2 pack of garlic bread, almost as good as co-op but is only worth it when you buy 2 for £2.50
Bad tier - mama’s cheesy garlic bread, I mean what else do you expect but the choices are limited at 3am
Shit tier - lidl 2 pack of garlic bread, just as expensive as the Tesco 2 pack but takes an extra 6 minutes in the oven and comes out soggy

During this difficult time, those who are most vulnerable may find it difficult to self-isolate because they have nobody to help go to the shops, post letters, walk the dog and other things that we might take for granted.
A local group has been created to help support people in the Cardiff area: https://www.facebook.com/groups/251990475816496/
If you are interested in offering assistance, skills or support for our mutual aid group, please fill in the form below.👇👇👇
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScmo5a0ldypZhtgpVUnOfeKD4tBWbY9XrWsSTjoAjaIvPfV9g/viewform?fbclid=IwAR2cPXs_4x0qV7jPZ5fjDs6yyZjRV5_LaG8ldVDZ2g9fDOrVnSXDKente10
If you know a person or a group of people that would benefit from this service please email: crhgmutualaid@gmail.com
‼️‼️‼️It is IMPORTANT that we don't spread the virus through our good intentions, so please only participate if you can guarantee the safety of others ♥️
DOCS.GOOGLE.COM
Roath, Cathays, Gabalfa & Heath COVID-19 mutual aid group: volunteer sign-up sheet

text:
#CardiffConfession7032
Ranting because I've heard this all too often recently... for all those saying "it's just the old people who die—you don't need to worry"... we do need to worry. About our grandparents, our already sick/immunocompromised relatives and friends, that lovely old woman across the street, the old man I danced with in Live Lounge, the elderly woman in the charity shop who was chatting to me about her grandkids... just because us young people are a bit safer than the rest, doesn't NOT mean we shouldn't worry. Worry for those who aren't as safe. Check on them, they're probably scared. And most of all, people should NOT make us feel weak and stupid for being worried. Rant over.

text:
#CardiffConfession7017
I consider myself as quite a slow learner, it takes time for me to fully understand things. When I came to uni I was expecting people to be mature about the fact everyone learns differently. As I came out of a seminar today, I heard someone walking behind me, saying, “I was trying so hard not to laugh at that boy just then”. I knew this was directed at me as I was the only male in the seminar group. Today was the first time in a while that I felt confident enough to express my understanding in a seminar, in doing so, I did misinterpret things but the way I learn is through getting things wrong and learning from it and being honest and saying “I’m not sure”. People making comments like that is the reason why I’m afraid to contribute. I just think people need to be more understanding of other people who take longer to process information. I would of thought we are all mature enough by now to accept that everyone learns differently at different rates.

As another week of CBR UK is coming I just wanted to put this out here...I try not to get political but can't keep silent any longer.
As a doctor who's recently qualified from Cardiff I have been involved with surgical abortions and I want to say I have never seen any woman who has not considered carefully what is a very difficult choice.
We will always be there to support your decision, hold your hand on the day if needs be. It is your body and your choice, you have your justifiable reasons. We are here for you.
It breaks my heart to see people who don't understand what people go through use shock tactics like CBR UK have been doing so. You deserve better.

#CardiffConfession7012
I am suffering with my mental health. Recently I have been doing really well but it is hard to stay on track when my friends flake or don’t bother to make the effort. I am killing myself trying to make effort but when it’s not reciprocated or even feels appreciated I feel myself slipping. If you have a friend who you know is suffering or has suffered in the past please make the effort. You don’t know how important your plans may have been or how much they would appreciate you making plans, even if it’s just to chill out. If someone is making effort with you and you don’t reciprocate don’t be surprised when they don’t bother anymore or if they spiral back into their depressed state again

Dear Cow-Murderers,
I am a vegan (planet-saving, death-defying, angel-person). You didn't ask but I wanted to tell you because my personality doesn't get me the attention my ego craves. I tell you, even though you can probably guess by looking at me, because it gives me a false sense of importance and because it distracts me from constantly craving a burger. Go about your (now-ruined) day with my doctored statistics ringing in your ears while I sit here and take industrially-produced, chemical supplements to stop my starving muscles wasting away.
Yours condescendingly,
A Holier-Than-Thou, Never-Harmed-A-Cow, Forever-Starting-Rows, Tree-Muncher

I lie awake to the cacophony that comes from next-door,
Blaming my headache on the thin walls and stupid thin floor.
Love your neighbour? I wish, but these girls I hate
As they plague my ears with their awful shouting ‘til late.
Tuesdays, Sundays, Thursdays? Yes, that’s right.
These neighbours ruin even the peaceful nights.
Some of us do real courses and need our sleep,
So neighbours, look forward to the fate that you’ll meet
I’m creating a log of your terrible sounds;
Dates, times and proof, so you’ll likely be found
A statutory nuisance under the UK Noise Act.
That’s right bitch, I’m reporting your ass.

It’s that time of year again where there is an influx of young gym bunnies, eager for gains, that decide to start using the membership they have already paid for in the Taly gym. Let me offer some guidelines to these gain hungry specimen to stop you from subconsciously making enemies in the gym:
1. ASK before taking the weights you need off the rack of the person who is using that rack- they’ll probably just say yes. Obviously let them finish their set first
2. RESTACK the weights after using them- no one wants to put your weights back just because you are too lazy to do it yourself
3. Maintain ORDER when restacking the weights, heaviest on the bottom row, lightest at the top, with the lightest weights easily accessible
BONUS- have a fucking chat once in a while, you never know, you could make gym buddies!!
Any other irritating things, please feel free to write in the comments.

text:
#CardiffConfession6956
I think what bums me out the most about university is how high and mighty everyone acts about attendance and extensions. If you miss classes, after a while people’s attitudes become, ‘why are you even at uni?’, ‘you are wasting your own money’ and ‘I don’t wanna be mean but you are, like, never here’, and when you say you have had extensions, people look at you like you cheated.
I understand this mentality towards people who literally can’t be bothered- but for people with mental disabilities, physical disabilities or issues at home it’s so incredibly hurtful to be told that people that don’t attend should ‘just drop out’. So make sure you know the difference and the people around you before you open your mouth, (or post on group chats). Some people had to work twice as hard to be in university because of things out of their control, don’t make them feel like they should give it all up when it’s literally non of your business how much other people attend.

Story time: a lovely girl in pryzm bequeathed me a tampon as I was in a rather dire situation. Hours pass and I awake and suddenly remember I need to remove said tampon . To my horror the tampon is nowhere to be seen. Not in the bin , under the bed or on the floor . And then it dawned on me - it must be stuck inside me !!! Therefore my amazing mate and I decide to walk to A and E still partially intoxicated at 9 am. After a 3 hour wait the doctor sees me , has a rummage and informs me the tampon is not inside me either!
Therefore if anyone finds a tampon on their morning walk to lectures in cathays , I am deeply sorry. Please return to owner.

text:
#CardiffConfession6913
a quick reminder, to make sure you know all of the places and people you can talk to this semester if you’re struggling:
-Counselling and wellbeing, at 50 Park Place, run their drop-in sessions and can setup longer ongoing support if you need.
-Student advice on the SU third floor can answer lots of your questions and will point you in the right direction if they can’t!
-Student led services like Mind Your Head, Nightline and Student Minds etc. run wellbeing events or if you just want a chat in a more relaxed setting, most of them have FB pages too.
-TalkCampus app is really good if you need to just say what’s on your mind anonymously.
-Loads of charities run helplines or webchats, like Samaritans or CALM, if you want to talk to someone with no connection to Cardiff.
I hope it’s a great year for you all, but if it isn’t- that’s okay! Just make sure you talk to someone, whether it’s one of the above or just a friend, just look after yourselves!

Definitive ranking of the glorious townships of Northern Ireland/The North of Ireland/The Northern part of an island that may or may not be British or Irish:
Elite Tier: Holywood Co. Down, Saintfield, anywhere in South Belfast (except the Holylands - dirty Queen’s students ruining our nice place :0), Ballyhackamore.
Great Tier: Second home destinations of permanent elite tier inhabitants - Portrush, Portstewart, Enniskillen (except Arlene Foster’s constituency office).
Average Tier: East Belfast, Lisburn, Coleraine, Strabane, Newcastle Co. Down.
Shit Tier: North Belfast, Omagh, Bangor, Craigavon, Newtownards, Ballymena (except the Ecos Centre <3), Dungannon.
Derry Tier: (London)Derry, West Belfast, Lurgan, Larne.
Your town didn’t make the cut? You’re probably a culchie and for that, I am sorry.

#CardiffConfession6880
Definitive ranking of the glorious townships of Northern Ireland/The North of Ireland/The Northern part of an island that may or may not be British or Irish:
Elite Tier: Holywood Co. Down, Saintfield, anywhere in South Belfast (except the Holylands - dirty Queen’s students ruining our nice place :0), Ballyhackamore.
Great Tier: Second home destinations of permanent elite tier inhabitants - Portrush, Portstewart, Enniskillen (except Arlene Foster’s constituency office).
Average Tier: East Belfast, Lisburn, Coleraine, Strabane, Newcastle Co. Down.
Shit Tier: North Belfast, Omagh, Bangor, Craigavon, Newtownards, Ballymena (except the Ecos Centre <3), Dungannon.
Derry Tier: (London)Derry, West Belfast, Lurgan, Larne.
Your town didn’t make the cut? You’re probably a culchie and for that, I am sorry.

The Walkers Stadium 15th September 2003.
Lilian Nalis's stunning volley hits the back of the net in the first goal of Leicester's 4-0 victory over Leeds, their first win of the season which Arsenal would of course go on to win undefeated, becoming immortalised as The Invincibles in the process.
But more importantly perhaps- behind the diving and well-beaten Paul Robinson- are the advertising hoardings, on which a little-known secret is revealed...
VK stands for "Vodka Kick".

Oh boots meal deal, how do I love thee?
Let me count the ways,
Your chicken mayo is sublime,
Especially when paired with a can of lemon and lime,
Your ham and emmental is also divine,
But I must admit your all day breakfast is... eh, fine,
Your yoghurt however is quite splendid,
And your price certainly doesnt need to be mended,
Your sushi, crisps and fruit are angelic,
And have contributed to my loving lyrics,
Salads, pastas, wraps too,
Boots will always be there for you,
So thank you for your student reduction,
It really is an act of seduction.

I clearly struggle with serious doubt within myself and haven’t been able to congratulate myself that I did it and that makes me sad.

Depends what type of bleeding you mean. Idk if you’re a guy or girl, but if you’re a girl and it’s like period blood, where it’s properly flowing out in large amounts, then definitely go get that checked out.
Or if it’s just a case of there being a tiny smear of blood when you wipe for example, then that’s probably fine and not worth getting checked. Sometimes the skin around the genitals and anus can tear resulting in a tiny amount of blood and that’s quite normal.
So just depends what sort of blood it is and how much of it there is

#CardiffConfession6708
A confession in the form of a late-night anecdote:
One night, after an escapade of much smoking and drinking, I decided to call it a night and head to bed. To my surprise, I was woken a few hours later to the sound of industrial-level slapping coming from the room next door. It was not unusual for me to hear my flatemate’s sexual activities late at night, so I thought little of it.
It was only when the noise ceased to stop that I began to question whether this was an episode of passionate lovemaking or pure domestic abuse. I decided to return to sleep, convincing myself that my good friend could never be capable of such an action.
The next morning, I bought it up with him and he answered me clearly and concisely -
THIS CRAZY FUCK WAS SPANKING HIS GIRLFRIEND WITH A COPY OF KARL MARX’S OWN COMMUNIST MANIFESTO.
I have begun to question what being at university is doing to the previously innocent minds of level-headed students in their late teens. Please share your own stories to help me retain my fucking sanity.

Tier of seats in the ASSL
God tier-
• Tables, with plugs, by the windows on the second and third floor
Good tier-
• Tables, with plugs, in the centre of the second floor. (the ones inside the weird glass rectangle)
• Single desks, with dividers and plugs, on the second floor. (also, inside the weird glass rectangle)
• Fancy white tables and desks on the first floor. (in and around the short-term loan section)
Ok tier-
• Single desks, with dividers but no plugs (maybe some by the wall if you’re luck), on the first, second, and third floor.
• Tables without plugs on the second and third floor
• Weird little study cupboards on the second and third floor
Shit tier-
• E-lounge
• Red chairs around those stupid tiny tables on the first floor
• Swastika desks on the third floor (seriously what is that about?)

text:
#CardiffConfession6658
I am currently in my first year of Uni and this first semester made me hate myself so much. I used to think I was at least decent looking but my gorgeous flatmates and coursemates (predominantly girls) make me feel like I am always too fat or ugly. I have started going to the gym to improve myself, but because I hate my face as well I find it hard to even look in the mirror and there is nothing I can do about it, I cannot change my facial features.
I am sure there are people around here that went through similar experiences, so please feel free to offer some advice. I am shattered and stopped wearing dresses, only wear black and baggy clothes and sometimes I feel so terrible about myself I refuse to get out of my room.
Everytime I try to mention this to someone I am told to shut up and that I look okay; but the real differences between me and other girls are clearly seen on the disgusted faces of guys in the club or in my flatmate's eyes when he looks at my attractive friend.

#CardiffConfession6655
#CardiffConfession6403
I completely agree!! Period poverty is very much real and happens to more people than you think!
I honestly cannot recommend to you enough a menstrual cup!! My whole perception of my period has changed because of it, I Genuinely forget that I’m on my period when wearing one because they are that good!
I realise they can be expensive! I use the organicup which cost £21 for 2. Other companies such as the heygirls cup only cost around £9 and although I haven’t used it myself I’m sure it’s just as good! Last I checked you could buy them in ripple living! Cups last years and are much more cost effective than tampons or sanitary towels
Look into it a little more before you buy to check if it’s right for you but I honestly think the cup is the answer to period poverty and reducing our waste! Seriously more people need to know about the cup, it’s a game changer.

XXX

#CardiffConfession6467 I’m so sorry to hear this happened to you, I hope you’re doing ok. I had something similar happen inside a Maccies in London a month ago and it really fucked me up. text:
#CardiffConfession6419
Fellow radar key holders of Cardiff. I know how hard nights out can be if you have an invisible disability and people and bouncers can get pissy with you for using the disabled toilet. With that in mind, I just wanted to say if going to the toilet puts you off a night out, Live Lounge is really good. Your key won’t work on the toilet itself but if you flash it to a bouncer they’ll open the door for you no questions. It’s honestly a God send when other clubs will try and accuse you of taking drugs or just block your access.
On a side note. Maybe the people who use the disabled toilets and don’t need them might understand a bit more from this why it’s an important issue for a lot of us. It can be the deciding factor to go out or not if you know a club isn’t inclusive or that the bouncers are going to try their hardest to make life at best more difficult and at worst kick you out for using the toilet. Think about that next time your entitled arse thinks it’s fun to just nip in.

#CardiffConfession6052
can the abortion protesters outside su main building please fuck off.
nobody wants to see a bunch of grown men with graphic images the size of a wall when they walk out of Costa.
and honestly, you have no right to trigger people or make people feel shit about the decisions they had to make for their mental and physical health, it's a really difficult thing to do, and it's hard enough out here.
the fact about abortion is that there are NO contraceptives which are 100% effective so accidents are gonna happen. abortion is healthcare and its our legal right to access it in this country.
the important thing is it's available for those who need it.
if you don't want to have an abortion, that's absolutely fine, I certainly wouldn't force you, but you can't tell others what is right and wrong, those are your views.
mind your own business, don't tell women what to do with their bodies, be mindful of your actions and just be kind, please x
from a girl who had an abortion, struggled a lot with the aftermath and is just trying to cope

text:
#CardiffConfession5954
Hey, so CPS has done a skeevy thing by asking that people let them in to have visits with a maximum of an hours notice, this is really illegal so I've attached a quick draft of an email I sent in response that basically tells them to go fuck themselves in legal jargon - Remember your rights kids, don't let them push you around and remember, if you can sue them, you're a hero.
Remember!
Correct notice for requesting access:
It is served and accepted at least 24 hours before the time of entry
The visit happens at a reasonable time of the day and allows the tenant to be present
Contains details about who will enter the property and for what reason
Respects the tenant’s right of quiet enjoyment of the property

text:
#CardiffConfession5794
It doesn’t hurt to be nice.
I challenge you to do one of these things.
- Smile at someone you may not know - it can go a long way.
- Give someone a compliment. Is their hair nice? Do they have great fashion? If so, let them know!
- Reach out to someone close and let them know you still think of them whilst being away at Uni.
- Let someone in front of you in the queue, if their shopping haul is smaller than yours.
- Still got pot noodles from freshers week? Donate them to a food bank.
- I you have the time and skill, bake something for your friends. For those with limited culinary skills, maybe skip this one...
- offer to wash someone’s dishes
Again, it doesn’t hurt to be nice. Everyone is going through something difficult, so doing a small favour like one of these can surprisingly change the outcome of someone’s day and if you can’t say anything nice? Don’t. Say. It. At. All. ✌️

text:
#CardiffConfession5665
From an anonymous friend...
Wednesday night I lost my hoodie: a story of love, friendship, and pain.
Once upon a time I was at my mates house and we needed to go outside but it was winter. He didn’t have any warm clothes, but fortunately his brother was in Australia so we took one of his hoodies. I became, over a number of years, spanning international territories, rather attached to this bland grey hoodie (with fairly overused image of the evolution of man culminating in a person behind a drum kit). On Wednesday night after a snowsports social, in queue to the union, I reluctantly parted with my beloved hoodie to shivering young girl after securing what I considered a solemn oath to return it.
I have no memory of the girl that broke my heart, but please consider reuniting it with it’s rightful owner before I am forever lost. Attached image is of me, a sweet dog, and an important, reliable piece of clothing.

Cheers

text:
#CardiffConfession4877
Sick of walking down Rhymney Street every wednesday afternoon and seeing shite literally everywhere because people can't PUT THE CORRECT WASTE IN THE CORRECT BAGS. Fucks me off seeing crap all over the road and people whinging about things like cuts to public services yet don't actually use their brains when throwing things away. It means it costs the council a lot more to sort it than it should. What's worse is that it's not students who foot the bill, it's working families who have to pay for your ignorance and lack of pride in keeping our community clean through their (quite frankly) exorbitant council taxes. It's the same story every week with the same houses along Rhymney Street doing this every time! As a result they have to send additional cleaning teams over to pick it up because you don't have the sense to realise that banana skins don't actually belong in recycling bags. I hope the houses responsible week on week finally get the fines they deserve for being such selfish pricks.

text:
#CardiffConfession4848
Just dropping in to tell men and women alike that it’s so important to talk about what’s going on. Seen too many awful stories on Twitter lately about girls who have lost their boyfriends to suicide and I don’t think it’s talked about enough (especially between men) that it’s okay not to be okay, but someone should know about it. Even just dropping your mate a message to ask if they are okay or if they want to go out and do something is helping. If people start to withdraw from their usual activities, don’t want to leave the house, are sleeping all day or not sleeping at all, chances are they’re dealing with something. Be the kind of friend you wish you had if you were struggling and encourage them to get help before it’s too late.
Just be there for each other lads and girls, you never know who might need it x

These type of comments really annoy me because I know many people (privately educated and not) who actually chose to come to Cardiff as their first choice and worked really hard to get here, so it’s very insulting to them, and really you’re just insulting yourself too (assuming you also go to Cardiff).
Also private school isn’t aslways about the highest grades, it’s about the experiences and opportunities you get there, and when others bash that it just makes them look bitter, not funny or clever.

#CardiffConfession4717
So we smuggled an egg into Pryzm on the 20th of May 2019 and i just want to say that it was the most exciting and awful experience of my life. I stored it in my underwear where it literally swapped with my left testicle, while being extremely cold, ripped it out of there outside the toilet before dancing around with my newly born child. Then ended up distressing multiple people with our egg child named Alfie, who then exploded on the disco floor which was a BIGSAD #rip . Not impressed with the new queues outside PRYZM and lost my hoodie mega tilted. Shout out to the fitty behind me in burger king with the red checked shirt who told me to get 99p burgers, you said you go to USW and do photography, i said I do biochem and go to Cardiff, please hit me up, legit we should get together or coffee. This whole experience was a fever dream, help me find my true love and hoodie, its white with black specks from Hollister xoxo Gossip Girl

text:
#CardiffConfession4715
Hey guys, hope this will reach those who will find it beneficial.
On Wednesday Xpress Radio are doing an event called Xpress Your Mental Health, a broadcast from 10:00-00:00 in which fellow students will talk about their experiences with mental health in hopes to break some of the stigma around mental health, live on air.
We aren’t claiming to be professionals or anything like that, we just want to open up the conversation around mental health and normalise the experiences we have.
We have a range of topics, from medication, stigmatisation, international students and mental health, men and mental health, LGBT+ mental health and more. Keep an eye on Xpress Radios social media for more info. We hope you’ll tune in and get involved for a wonderful cause.
Thank you 💜

text:
#CardiffConfession4607
Honestly the absolute nerve of the SU president to accuse the Cardiff university community, the very same one that voted her into power, of being racist because she’s being questioned about her priorities.
I watched the video linked and it’s 30 minutes of mostly left wing intersectinality, along with deflecting any criticism as simply “it’s because I’m Muslim”, with a sprinkle of childish “clap backs” like correcting the £47,000 being raised is actually £48,000 and pausing after the point as if completely disarms the criticism.
It’s a crying shame as there are legitimate reasons for her cause but I feel she’s forgetting that being head of 35,000 students, you’re going to receive criticism as you’re in a position that answers to the community so you need to be prepared to justify your actions.
Don’t just let some anonymous post tell you how to feel, watch the video for yourself. She wants it to be shared and spread.
#YaGetMe

#CardiffConfession4592
Bringing us back to some actual, true and deep confessions. This is quite a hard one to make... I’ve kept it secret for so long.... I like the Big Bang theory... I’ve rewatched all of the seasons at least four times now. I’ve not told anyone. The only one that knows is my dog. I feel as though I’m living in sin as my flatmates have already expressed their outright hatred for it. I don’t know how many more “so what are you watching on Netflix atm?”s I can take. Or even the slamming of my laptop when someone enters my room. It has come to the point where I feel I’d rather say I’m watching porn. Any advice other than “Stop having a shit taste in telly shows” cause there’s not much I can do about that... #sendhelp

text:
#CardiffConfession4239
After taking a year out of uni, it is hilarious to watch how many of the self professed besties in my ex friendship group have turned out to be enemies.
As an outsider from that year now, multiple people in that friendship group have confided in me that they dislike the people they chose to live with and have been friends with for the last 2 years. Having taken time out of uni i realised how all the cliques and groups are a fake illusion and that when u leave uni, you leave with one or two real friends, and nothing else. Moral of the story - don't waste your precious 3 years of uni in friendship groups for social security. It's an illusion that pops like a balloon the minute you leave university.

text:
#CardiffConfession4065
What are people's thoughts on extinction rebellion and their actions of late?
Initial reaction from me was "don't be a dick, London commuters didn't do anything to deserve this" but then I thought about how absolutely fucked we are, and how inconvenienced we will all be in a few years if we don't take our foot off the gas, so now I suddenly have a strange urge to glue my arse to the doors of Buckingham palace.
I don't want to set anyone's day back but also feel like the panick button should've been pressed when we were kids.. helpless and hopeless, may as well try and do something.

What the fuck is it with people turning up late to lectures? Not as a one off, but every. Single. Lecture. How do you do it? Surely you’d at least have learnt by now to leave 5mins earlier, than the last time that you ended up late. Some of you are later than a god damn doctor at placement. Did mummy and daddy never strap a watch to your wrist and teach you to count? Turn up before the big hand hits the 12 and you’ll be sweet. If not, we’ll all continue to despise you, and your piss poor punctuality. Amen.
~A pissed off Punctual Freak

Heya, i saw a few people wanting help with mental health etc, so i created a page called "Cardiff Real Talks", its just somewhere where you can post anonymously if theres any issues or anything you dont feel comfortable saying to people you know.
its not affiliated with Cardiff Confessions at all, sorry just making that clear
and we aren't therapists, if you truly need help you should seek it professionally, but just so that people can talk about anything they feel comfortable enough saying which theyre having issues with
Don't think im allowed to put a link in here so just search away :)

#CardiffConfession3628
Imagine this: you wake up on January 1st, and spontaneously decide that being veggie is a fucking brilliant idea for a New Years resolution. You sacrifice nights out because you have to spend your entire weekly budget on astronomically priced Quorn, you have to smile through the grimness of having a nut roast while you sadly gaze at the roast beef sat on your mates plate, you're forced to break the bank on £3.99 Veggie Deluxe in Maccies whilst everyone else tucks into their 99p cheeseburger offered on the savers menu.
SIX WEEKS of this torture I've endured just to take the moral highground, and what do I do after a few too many in Pryzm?
Practically inhale three chicken mayos without a second thought
hate myself

text:
#CardiffConfession3551
Hello. This is a hard confession to make, but I have been witness to multiple and continuous thefts of food by my closest friends in my flat, stealing food when others aren’t in the kitchen by simply sticking their hand in and grabbing what isn’t theirs from my other flatmates’ cooking or fridge items, gobbling down the contents with the fridge door ajar. I believe this to be revolting and unacceptable (which I have told the thiefs) and yet the finger-sticking-in-and-licking continues exponentially with no sign of stopping.
I came here to ask whether I should expose these snack-snatchers, these pasta-pickers, these goody-grabbers, to the affected flatmates, or whether I should remain tight lipped while this heartless and quite frankly selfish treachery continues. I don’t know whether this misconduct is one of the typical features of uni life, but to me it seems simply wrong.
Yours sincerely,
A troubled first year
post_text:
#CardiffConfession3551

#CardiffConfession3396
Seen something similar posted and loved the response - Slightly different for me though. I’m not really sure how everyone has managed to meet friends at uni. Back home I’ve got plenty of mates and I’m a very outgoing person but I’ve just not managed to make friends as my days usually consist of going to my lectures and then coming home and sitting in my room. Bit embarassed to be asking this but how can I go about making some quality friends as not having friends to go out and do things with is rather alien to me and it’s not something I’d like to get used to, so please, if anyone has any good advice then let’s hear it x

text:
#CardiffConfession3347
Does anyone else have a really poor relationship with their parents? Like no matter what you did or didn't do you feel like a massive disappointment. When you're in uni you get texts constantly that bring you down. And when you're home they say that they didn't miss you and that you bring out the worst in your siblings... Yet despite all the negative comments your parents still want you to come home and visit and help them out. And honestly what is the point? Does anyone else feel like a stranger in their home or is it just me? Because I'm so sick of it, yet when I don't go visit I feel guilty. I cannot win :(
post_text:

#CardiffConfession3279
A message to the people who get butt hurt over confessions about other unis,
Every uni does it about their rivals, it’s not confined to just Cardiff. None of them are serious, it’s just people conforming with a rivalry. If you get offended by these posts just don’t read them. Swansea do the same about Cardiff and you don’t see any of them getting butt hurt over it. Uni rivalry does nothing more than make sports teams perform better and stronger as well as unis trying to better themselves academically.

I saw someting similar on brumfess earlier and thought it was a really nice idea. Are there any first years out there finding it hard to make friends/meet people but still want to go out? Maybe you don't get on with your flatmates or coursemates, or maybe you just want to find more people who enjoy the same events/hobbies/etc as you but don't know how as your societies dont do the weekly socials. If you feel like a bit lonely or know someone struggling with this kind of thing, do comment below and if this gets a genuine response I will make a chat where people can get to know eachother.

text:
#CardiffConfession3180
To our attic-dwelling housemate:
Please stop leaving your door wedged open. All your noise travels down as it is, before you grace us all with an amplified version of your appalling singing/dance routines to various MJ songs, not to mention your daily phone calls (p.s why are they always on loudspeaker?? Just hold the phone to your ear, we’re begging). Further to that point, who the fuck are you actually speaking to on the phone all the time? You seem physically incapable of holding eye contact, let alone a conversation with anyone in person. Please sort it out, or we will hold an intervention and make you relocate to the ground floor room.
Regards
Your (so done) housemates
(P.S. we know it’s you who never cleans the hob and leaves the loo blocked while you go off to uni, so, for the love of God, stop that too)

text:
#CardiffConfession2900
Fish and Chip reviews #3 - Cathay’s Fish Bar
A little known fact is that in Ronald Reagan’s famous speech about the shinning city on the hill speech actually refers not to the United States but to Cathays fish bar “whose beacon light guides freedom-loving people everywhere.”
Unfortunately freedom in this case is the freedom to make poor life’s choices, like eating at Cathays fish bar.
Like America ,Cathays Fish Bar’s portions are oversized, unhealthy and (judging by how greasy the fish is) can only be sustained by exploiting oil rich nations.
However there are a few positives to Cathays fish bar, the food is cheap, the chips are decent and unlike Khan’s fish bar they have haddock (which is better than cod if you disagree then start your own fish and chip focused media empire.)
Overall this adds up to a thoroughly average eating experience to which I attribute a 5/10
I’m very keen to see the best of what Cardiff has to offer to please recommend any good fish and chip places in the comments and I will check them out.
post_text:

A little known fact is that in Ronald Reagan’s famous speech about the shinning city on the hill speech actually refers not to the United States but to Cathays fish bar “whose beacon light guides freedom-loving people everywhere.”
Unfortunately freedom in this case is the freedom to make poor life’s choices, like eating at Cathays fish bar.
Like America ,Cathays Fish Bar’s portions are oversized, unhealthy and (judging by how greasy the fish is) can only be sustained by exploiting oil rich nations.
However there are a few positives to Cathays fish bar, the food is cheap, the chips are decent and unlike Khan’s fish bar they have haddock (which is better than cod if you disagree then start your own fish and chip focused media empire.)
Overall this adds up to a thoroughly average eating experience to which I attribute a 5/10
I’m very keen to see the best of what Cardiff has to offer to please recommend any good fish and chip places in the comments and I will check them out.

text:
#CardiffConfession2718
As a Fresher, I have met so many people the last few weeks,
when I speak to them, they all seem humble and meek.
There are more than 300 on my course and I feel like I know them all,
I met so many at the Freshers Ball.
I don't know who is my fake and who is my real friend,
As they talk about finalising Housing for next year, I know Bad is how it will end.
I go out out and also stay in with my 'friends'
But I don't make any fond memories, its just money spent.
People said uni years are the best years of your life,
But actually coming has made me think twice.
I really miss my friends from back home,
I just Spat these bars straight off the dome,

text:
#CardiffConfession2517
I'm an international student and I used to think anyone crying racism is just a sensitive snowflake but now after actually being with people here I feel like the tag "racism still exists" isn't wrong. It isn't so much that people are rude or discriminatory. It's just the way they look, talk and act around you is a bit different. It's very subtle. It's a sad realization and I don't intend this post to call everyone here racist but please just remember that we are just normal girls/boys like you. Yes we have different cultures and accents but come interact with us and you'll find that we are not entirely that different. We might just make good friends.
Sorry if this post upsets/angers anyone. And yes, it's entirely possible that the way I feel I'm being treated is probably just because of me as a person and not because of my brown colour. In fact, I hope that is the case.
post_text:

text:
#CardiffConfession2323
I don't understand why so many people, students included, are so desperate to be in a relationship with someone. Relationships aren't going to fix your problems, and if you expect them to then you're a shit person. A relationship should be two people who are happy being independent, and who take responsibility for their actions; enjoying each others company, and watching eachother grow and achieve.
Dependence, or co-dependence in a relationship is unhealthy, and that is the type of 'toxic' relationship that everyone complains about being in.
Sort your shit out first, get to a point where you're happy, surround yourself with people who are in the same state. Only then will you find someone who you can share the personal growth with, and enjoy having them as part of your life.

One time at a not-so-friends house party, the place was so unbelievably filthy and covered with dog hair that I necked a half glass of vodka without mixer or dinner beforehand. Within 20mins, I was on a chair being fed dog biscuits dipped in tesco finest sour cream and chive dip. Next thing I hear an absolute tune coming from the living room in which compelled me to run and slide into the room barefoot with half eaten dog biscuits in my mouth, arm out like superman, and punch my boyfriend dead in the face before falling into the odd collection of ornaments at the fireplace and breaking them all. Safe to say, I no longer talk to the people who attended that party.

My house mate quickly answered it and quickly shouted “did anyone order a dominos?” - quick thinking lead one of us to replying “yes!!!”. I don’t understand how smoking is considered “cool” at Uni. Sure, at school you’ve got that ‘rebel-without-a-clue” attitude and you could identify the cool kids as the ones having a cheeky fag behind the bike-sheds.
But at Uni we’re all of legal age to smoke, and spent many years being presented and even tested on the scientific evidence of why it’s a dumb idea...so why is it still cool? I thought we were all meant to be intelligent...
From: a confused square.

text:
#CardiffConfession1080
I was dragged to a pres at Taly North on a cold rainy night a few months ago. I was only there to wingman my mate with this bird, so only knew him. I was sat at this pres when I suddenly realised I really needed a shit. So I downed my beer and said I was going to Tesco to get more thinking that I could quickly use the facilities of the girl I was meant to be wingmanning my mate with. Doing so I made my excuse and snuck into her toilet. Upon beginning the process I realised it would take much longer than I originally thought. 20 minutes later as I reached for the handle of her door to leave to Tesco, the sunddenly door opened. Without thinking I jumped behind the door and hid, just as she and a friend walked in. They immediately complained about the smell wondering how it had got there and turned to leave just as the door closed behind them leaving stood me pressed against the wall without my cover. They saw me and as they realised what I had done; I turned, opened the door and ran.

text:
#CardiffConfession947
When I was younger I shared a bunk bed with my younger brother. I was also really into Star Wars, and like any child I enjoyed pretending to be my favourite characters. I took it one step further however and when I went to bed I'd pull the duvet up over my head so it was pulled tight against my feet. I'd then get remote control car and helicopter remotes and pretend to be an X-Wing star fighter pilot. Flying alongside Luke Skywalker as he destroyed the first Death Star and escorting Lando in my A-Wing as he destroyed the second Death Star over Endor. I had one remote which was my favourite, it was for a remote control car and had a trigger. I could pretend to shoot down the enemy Tie fighters. One night my brother asked me what I was doing and I explained and he wanted to join in. So I let him sit behind me and pretend to be R2-D2. He had all the beeps and whistles down and every night we'd rush robbed to take on our next mission together.

You don't actually have a 'library crush', the only reason people seem to be more attractive at this time of year is because of the Misattribution of Arousal (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misattribution_of_arousal), where people mistake their emotions, such as fear, for romantic attraction. You don't have a 'library crush', your brain is just trying to internalize the fact you are going to fail all your exams.
